register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: Software End Of Interrupt (EOI) control. Write number of interrupt output to force re-evaluation of associated pending interrupts. Write n: EOI for interrupt output associated with EOI #n.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector, line #0. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled.
Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector, line #0. Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to clear (disable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _SET register.
Per-event raw interrupt status vector, line #1. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled.
Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector, line #1. Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to clear (disable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _SET register.
Per-event raw interrupt status vector, line #2. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled.
Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector, line #2. Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to clear (disable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _SET register.
Per-event raw interrupt status vector, line #3. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled.
Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector, line #3. Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.
Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to clear (disable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _SET register.
CAM output port #1 configuration This register associate one bit for each context in order to enable/disable each context individually.

bitfield.description: Number of lanes of PHY4 when NUM_PHY 3
Number of lanes of PHY3 when NUM_PHY 2
Number of lanes of PHY2 when NUM_PHY 1
MSB, LSB alignment for output pixel data 0: LSB align 1: MSB align
Transmit format of none SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
1: enables checking of the checksum transmitted in the APTINA HiSPi data stream
Transmit format of SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
Word width of recovered parallel data. 0: 8-BITS 1: 10-BITS 2: 12-BITS 3: 14-BITS 4: 16-BITS 5-7: RESERVED

Specifies Initial frame state in mode2,mode4,mod5 and mode8. If the first comming sync code is knows as start of frame(SOF) when enable decoding, it is able to write 0. If sync code is unknown, should write 1. In other mode, should be coded 0.

Protocol selection 0: Serial LVDS mode 1 1: Serial LVDS mode 2 2: Serial LVDS mode 3 3: Serial LVDS mode 4 4: Serial LVDS mode 5 5: Serial LVDS mode 6 6: Serial LVDS mode 7 7: Serial LVDS mode 8 8: Serial LVDS mode 9 9-15: Reserved
Frame size in number of image lines
Image line width in number of data words
The maximum line width expected in number of pixels.
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of Frame) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Frame) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of V-blanking) sync pattern

register.description: CAM output port #2 configuration This register associate one bit for each context in order to enable/disable each context individually.

bitfield.description: MSB, LSB alignment for output pixel data 0: LSB align 1: MSB align
Transmit format of none SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
1: enables checking of the checksum transmitted in the APTINA HiSPi data stream
Transmit format of SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
Word width of recovered parallel data. 0: 8-BITS 1: 10-BITS 2: 12-BITS 3: 14-BITS 4: 16-BITS 5-7: RESERVED

Specifies Initial frame state in mode2,mode4,mod5 and mode8. If the first comming sync code is knows as start of frame(SOF) when enable decoding, it is able to write 0. If sync code is unknown, should write 1. In other mode, should be coded 0.

The maximum line width expected in number of pixels.
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of Frame) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Frame) sync pattern

Specifies SOF(Start Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.

1: enables checking of the checksum transmitted in the APTINA HiSPi data stream

Word width of recovered parallel data. 0: 8-BITS 1: 10-BITS 2: 12-BITS 3: 14-BITS 4: 16-BITS 5-7: RESERVED

register.description: CAM output port #4 configuration This register associate one bit for each context in order to enable/disable each context individually.

bitfield.description: MSB, LSB alignment for output pixel data 0: LSB align 1: MSB align
Transmit format of none SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
1: enables checking of the checksum transmitted in the APTINA HiSPi data stream
Transmit format of SYNC area 0: Little endian 1: big endian
Word width of recovered parallel data. 0: 8-BITS 1: 10-BITS 2: 12-BITS 3: 14-BITS 4: 16-BITS 5-7: RESERVED

Specifies Initial frame state in mode2,mode4,mod5 and mode8. If the first comming sync code is knows as start of frame(SOF) when enable decoding, it is able to write 0. If sync code is unknown, should write 1. In other mode, should be coded 0.

Protocol selection 0: Serial LVDS mode 1 1: Serial LVDS mode 2 2: Serial LVDS mode 3 3: Serial LVDS mode 4 4: Serial LVDS mode 5 5: Serial LVDS mode 6 6: Serial LVDS mode 7 7: Serial LVDS mode 8 8: Serial LVDS mode 9 9-13: Reserved 14: CMOS parallel IF (CCIR656 embeded sync) 15: CMOS parallel IF (extenal HSYNC/VSYNC) When in mode 14,15, the input parallel i/f signals go to CAM #4 output port.)
Frame size in number of image lines
Image line width in number of data words
The maximum line width expected in number of pixels.
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of Frame) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Frame) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(End Of Line) sync pattern
Specifies the mask bit to be compared. Ex.) set 0x3ff when does pattern matching for low 10bit.
Specifies SOF(Start Of V-blanking) sync pattern
WDR mode select 0: de-companding 1: bit interlaced format Not alloweed to code 1 to WDRENA3 and WDRENA4 at the same time.
WDR mode enable for CAM port #4. 0: disable 1: enable WDR function Not alloweed to code 1 to WDRENA3 and WDRENA4 at the same time.
WDR mode enable for CAM port #3. 0: disable 1: enable WDR function Not alloweed to code 1 to WDRENA3 and WDRENA4 at the same time.
WDR mode enable for CAM port #2. 0: disable 1: enable WDR function Not alloweed to code 1 to WDRENA1 and WDRENA2 at the same time.
WDR mode enable for CAM port #1. 0: disable 1: enable WDR function Not alloweed to code 1 to WDRENA1 and WDRENA2 at the same time.
Specifies the pixel level for area #1 knee point inX/ Y axis. Level = WDRNPXY1 * 256
Specifies the gain for area #4 Gain = 1/2^WDRGN4
Specifies the gain for area #3 Gain = 1/2^WDRGN3
Specifies the gain for area #2 Gain = 1/2^WDRGN2
Specifies the pixel level for area #3 knee point in Y axis. Level = WDRNPY3 * 256
Specifies the pixel level for area #2 knee point in Y axis. Level = WDRNPY2 * 256
Specifies the pixel level for area #3 knee point in X axis. Level = WDRNPX3
Specifies the pixel level for area #2 knee point in X axis. Level = WDRNPX2

register.description: When.CAM1TEST=1, PHY #1 data (8bitx4 lanes) can be monitored by this register.
When.CAM2TEST=1, PHY #2 data (8bitx4 lanes) can be monitored by this register.
When.CAM3TEST=1, PHY #3 data (8bitx4 lanes) can be monitored by this register.
When.CAM4TEST=1, PHY #4 data (8bitx4 lanes) can be monitored by this register.
